intro: Tussilago glabrescens, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Tussilago glabrescens is often found in meadows, prairies, and along roadsides. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in native plant communities.
